meanings.definition: Unleavened bread traditionally eaten by Jews during Passover.
meanings.sent1: During Passover, my family enjoys eating matzo with bitter herbs.
meanings.sent2: The matzo was carefully prepared and served on the Seder plate.
meanings.sent3: Why did the matzo go to school? To get a little 'bread'ucation!
meanings.sent4: The matzo, like a symbol of history, connects us to our ancestors' traditions.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked matzo filled the kitchen, reminding us of the holiday.

meanings.definition: A flat, thin cracker-like bread made of flour and water.
meanings.sent1: I like to spread butter on my matzo for a simple snack.
meanings.sent2: The store sells different varieties of matzo, including whole wheat and plain.
meanings.sent3: Why did the matzo break up with the loaf of bread? It needed some space to rise!
meanings.sent4: The crunch of the matzo echoed through the quiet room, adding a unique texture to the meal.
meanings.sent5: As I took a bite of the matzo, its crispness reminded me of a delicate cracker.
